member.name: P:AmosGraphics.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:AmosGraphics.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:AmosGraphics.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a variable's parameter constraints and parameter estimates are displayed in a bold font.
[jim] 7/7/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a variable's parameter constraints and parameter estimates are displayed in an italic font.
[jim] 7/7/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a value that determines whether a rectangle or ellipse is to be transparent or is to be filled with the solid color specified by the FillColor property.
[jim] 7/7/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
A positive integer. For a single-headed arrow, obj1 is the object the arrow points away from. For a double-headed arrow, obj1 is one of the objects pointed to.
[jim] 7/7/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
A positive integer. For a single-headed arrow, obj2 is the object the arrow points to. For a double-headed arrow, obj2 is one of the objects pointed to.
[jim] 7/7/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets the parameter formats for this object. These formats override those specified in the View Interface Properties dialog.
[jim] 7/7/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
For rectangles, gets or sets the x coordinate of the lower right corner. For ellipses, gets or sets the x coordinate of the lower right corner of the bounding rectangle.
[jim] 7/7/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
For rectangles, gets or sets the y coordinate of the lower right corner. For ellipses, gets or sets the y coordinate of the lower right corner of the bounding rectangle.
[jim] 7/7/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets a value that is True for unique variables -- i.e., for variables that are unobserved and exogenous, and that affect only one other variable.
[jim] 7/9/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a value that is True for the object that is highlighted and False for other objects. (By default, the "highlighted" object is colored red.)
[jim] 7/9/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a value that is True for a path diagram element that is "selected". Typically, path diagram elements are selected by using using the EditSelect method or the EditSelectAll method.
[jim] 7/7/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets a rectangle or an ellipse (an object of type PDElement.) For a single-headed arrow, Variable1 is the object that the arrow points away from. For a double-headed arrow, Variable1 is one of the objects that the arrow points to.
[jim] 7/9/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets a rectangle or an ellipse (an object of type PDElement.) For a single-headed arrow, Variable2 is the object that the arrow points to. For a double-headed arrow, Variable2 is one of the objects that the arrow points to.
[jim] 7/9/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets the parameter formats for this object. These formats override those specified with in the View Interface Properties dialog.
[jim] 7/9/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.PreFitOptions
member.summary: Event that occurs before model fitting.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.PostFitResults
member.summary: Event that occurs after model fitting is complete.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.MouseDown
member.summary: Event that occurs when a mouse button is pressed.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.MouseUp
member.summary: Event that occurs when a mouse button is released.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.Quitting
member.summary: Event that occurs when the Amos Graphics window is closed.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.NewObjectCreated
member.summary: Event that occurs after a new object is added to the path diagram.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.OutputIsInvalid
member.summary: Event that occurs when Amos Graphics disables the toolbox buttons and the menu items that are used for displaying results.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.ButtonPressed
member.summary: Event that occurs when a toolbox button, or the equivalent menu item, is clicked.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.QueryUnload
member.summary: Event that occurs before the Amos Graphics window closes. You can use this event to keep the Amos Graphics window from closing.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.OpenWindowsUpdated
member.summary: Event that occurs when a change in the model or the data requires an update of various open Amos Graphics windows.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.AboutToShowMsgBox
member.summary: Event that occurs just before Amos Graphics displays certain message boxes.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.AmwFileWritten
member.summary: Event that occurs after Amos Graphics has finished writing a path diagram (*.amw) file.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.AmwFileRead
member.summary: Event that occurs after Amos Graphics has finished reading a path diagram (*.amw) file.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.PDChanged
member.summary: Event that occurs when Amos Graphics starts a new path diagram or opens an existing path diagram.

member.name: E:AmosGraphics.pd.ObjectEntered
member.summary: Event that occurs when the mouse pointer comes close to an object and the object changes color.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Opens a dialog to allow the user to specify the database file (or files) to be analyzed. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item File->Data Files.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Forms a group of objects that will be treated as a unit in future operations. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Edit->Link.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Allows the user to change the size and shape of variables (rectangles and ellipses). Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Edit->Shape of Object.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Arranges selected objects so that they are equally spaced horizontally. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Edit->Space Horizontally.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Arranges selected objects so that they are equally spaced vertically. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Edit->Space Vertically.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Resizes the path diagram (not just its screen image) so that it fits on a page. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Edit->Fit to Page.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: P:AmosGraphics.pd.IsViewingPathDiagram
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that is True if the Path Diagram view is selected and False otherwise. Set IsViewingPathDiagram=True to display the Path Diagram view.

member.name: P:AmosGraphics.pd.IsViewingTables
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that is True if the Tables view is selected and False otherwise. Set IsViewingTables=True to display the Tables view.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.ViewSwitchToOtherView
member.summary: Switches to a different view of the model.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Resizes the screen image of the path diagram so that one printed page just fits the Amos window.window. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Diagram->Zoom Page.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Change the name and the definition of an existing model.
The number of the model to change. Models are numbered starting with 1. New name for the model. New constraints for the model. The existing constraints are replaced by the new constraints.
[jim] 7/9/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Opens a dialog for creating, modifying and deleting models. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Analyze->Manage Models.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Turns on or off the preservation of symmetries when objects are moved and resized. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Tools->Smart.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Turns on or off the display of variable names, parameter constraints and arrow heads. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Tools->Outline.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Displays the Amos Graphics window maximized without a title bar, or displays it normally.
If true, display maximized without a title var. If false, display normally.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Opens a help window and displays the table of contents for Amos's online help system. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Help->Contents.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Uses your web browser to visit the Amos page at the Amos Development web site. Equivalent to the Amos Graphics menu item Help->Amos on the Web.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets the collection of all rectangles, ellipses, arrows and figure captions in the path diagram for the currently displayed group.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Displays the input path diagram. Equivalent to pressing the 'Input' button in the upper-left corner of the path diagram window.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Displays the output path diagram. Equivalent to pressing the 'Output' button in the upper-left corner of the path diagram window.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Makes the arrows in the path diagram change color when the mouse pointer approaches. Use this method to let the user click an arrow.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets a RadioButton control in an Amos Graphics window.
The name of a Windows Forms form The name of a Windows Forms control
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.GetComboBox(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a ComboBox control in an Amos Graphics window.
member.param: The name of a Windows Forms form
The name of a Windows Forms control

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.GetNumericUpDown(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a NumericUpDown control in an Amos Graphics window.
member.param: The name of a Windows Forms form
The name of a Windows Forms control

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If Amos Graphics has an open modal dialog that may prevent it from responding correctly to calls to its methods and properties, the CanRespond method returns an explanatory string. Otherwise, it returns an empty string.
[jim] 7/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.ListOfObservedVariables
member.summary: Get a list of the observed variables in the current group.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.ListOfUnobservedVariables
member.summary: Get a list of the unobserved variables in the current group.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.Observed(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Draws a rectangle to represent an observed variable.
member.param: The name of the observed variable.

The name of the variable's mean (if the variable is exogenous) or intercept (if the variable is endogenous). If means and intercepts are not explicit model parameters, meanName should be the empty string.
A name for the variable's variance. varianceName should be supplied as an argument to the Observed method only when creating an exogenous variable.
The distance from the left edge of the path diagram to the center of the rectangle, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The distance from the top edge of the path diagram to the center of the rectangle, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The rectangle's width, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The rectangle's height, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
member.returns: A rectangle in the path diagram that represents an observed variable in the model.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.Unobserved(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Draws an ellipse to represent an unobserved variable.
member.param: The name of the unobserved variable.

The name of the variable's mean (if the variable is exogenous) or intercept (if the variable is endogenous). If means and intercepts are not explicit model parameters, meanOrInterceptName should be the empty string.
A name for the variable's variance. varianceName should be supplied as an argument to the Unobserved method only when creating an exogenous variable.
The distance from the left edge of the path diagram to the center of the ellipse, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The distance from the top edge of the path diagram to the center of the ellipse, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The ellipse's width, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The ellipse's height, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
member.returns: An ellipse in the path diagram that represents an unobserved variable in the model.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.Observed(System.String,System.Double,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Draws a rectangle to represent an observed variable. This overload of the Observed method should be used only when means and intercepts are explicit model parameters.
member.param: The name of the observed variable.
The value of the variable's mean (if the variable is exogenous) or intercept (if the variable is endogenous).
A name for the variable's variance. varianceName should be supplied as an argument to the Observed method only when creating an exogenous variable.
The distance from the left edge of the path diagram to the center of the rectangle, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The distance from the top edge of the path diagram to the center of the rectangle, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The rectangle's width, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The rectangle's height, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
member.returns: A rectangle in the path diagram that represents an observed variable in the model.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.Unobserved(System.String,System.Double,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Draws an ellipse to represent an unobserved variable. This overload of the Unobserved method should be used only when means and intercepts are explicit model parameters.
member.param: The name of the unobserved variable.
The value of the variable's mean (if the variable is exogenous) or intercept (if the variable is endogenous).
A name for the variable's variance. varianceName should be supplied as an argument to the Unobserved method only when creating an exogenous variable.
The distance from the left edge of the path diagram to the center of the ellipse, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The distance from the top edge of the path diagram to the center of the ellipse, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The ellipse's width, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
The ellipse's height, measured in units of 1/96 inch.
member.returns: An ellipse in the path diagram that represents an unobserved variable in the model.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.Path(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Draws a single-headed arrow.
member.param: The name of the variable that the new single-headed arrow points to.
The name of the variable that the new single-headed arrow points away from.
A name for the regression weight represented by the new single-headed arrow.
member.returns: The new single-headed arrow.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.Cov(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Draws a double-headed arrow.
member.param: The name of one of the two variables to be connected by the new double-headed arrow.
The name of one of the two variables to be connected by the new double-headed arrow.
A name for the covariance represented by the new double-headed arrow.
member.returns: The new double-headed arrow.

member.returns: The new double-headed arrow.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.Path(AmosGraphics.PDElement,AmosGraphics.PDElement)
member.summary: Draws a single-headed arrow.
member.param: The variable that the new single-headed arrow points to.
The variable that the new single-headed arrow points away from.
member.returns: The new single-headed arrow.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.Cov(AmosGraphics.PDElement,AmosGraphics.PDElement)
member.summary: Draws a double-headed arrow.

One of the two variables to be connected by the new double-headed arrow.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.Caption(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,AmosGraphics.PDElement.TitlePositionEnum)
member.summary: Creates a figure caption.
member.param: The horizontal position of the caption measured in units of 1/96 inch. (The horizontal position is also affected by the position argument.)
The vertical distance from the top edge of the path diagram to the center of the figure caption, measured in units of 1/96 inch.

An enumeration that specifies one of the following ways of formatting the new figure caption: (0) Centered at the caption's x coordinate, (1) Left Justified at the caption's x coordinate, (2) Right justified at the caption's x coordinate, (3) Centered horizontally on the path diagram.
member.returns: The newly created figure caption.

member.name: M:AmosGraphics.pd.Caption(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a figure caption.
member.returns: The newly created figure caption.
